title: Mixing Tags and Positional
goal: Learn to efficiently combine place tags with positional placement.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Complete tag system:

fa = x1, fe = x2, fi = x3, fo = x4, fu = x5

Write with full tags: mi dunda la cukta la .bob. → ?

(Answer: fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta fi la .bob.)

New Material (5-7 min)

Mixing Tags and Positional Placement

fa mi cu dunda la cukta fi la .bob. — I give a book to Bob.

You don't have to tag every sumti. You can mix:

  • Tagged sumti: explicitly marked
  • Positional sumti: fill places in order after a tag

The Rule

After a tag, sumti without tags fill the next places sequentially.

Sentence Interpretation
fa mi cu dunda la cukta la .bob. x1=mi, then x2=la cukta, x3=la .bob. (positional)
fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda la cukta x3=la .bob., x1=mi, then x2=la cukta (positional)

Examples

Tag only x1:

fa mi cu viska la cukta

x1=mi (tagged), x2=la cukta (positional after selbri)

Tag x3, leave x2 positional:

fa mi cu dunda la cukta fi la .bob.

x1=mi, x2=la cukta (positional), x3=la .bob. (tagged)

Tag x3 first:

fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta

x3=la .bob., x1=mi, x2=la cukta

When to Mix

Mix tags and positional when:

  1. You want to mention one argument first but keep the rest simple
  2. Most places are in normal order, with one exception

Efficient:

fi la .bob. cu dunda mi la cukta

Wait — without fa, does mi become x1? Yes! After selbri, untagged sumti fill remaining places.

Actually, this is ambiguous. Better:

fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta

Best Practice

When mixing:

  1. Tag any out-of-order sumti
  2. Positional sumti follow normal left-to-right order
  3. When in doubt, add more tags for clarity

Key Point

You can mix tags and positional placement. Untagged sumti after a tagged one fill places sequentially. Use extra tags when clarity is needed.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Interpret Mixed Sentences

Identify x1, x2, x3:

  1. fa mi cu dunda la cukta la .alis.
  2. fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda la skami
  3. fe la karce fa la .alis. cu ponse
Answers
  1. x1=mi, x2=la cukta, x3=la .alis.
  2. x1=mi, x2=la skami, x3=la .bob.
  3. x1=la .alis., x2=la karce

Exercise 2: Rewrite Efficiently

Rewrite with minimal tags (only tag what's out of order):

  1. fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta fi la .bob. (all in order) → ?
  2. Recipient first, rest in order: la .bob. receives a book from me → ?
Answers
  1. mi dunda la cukta la .bob. (no tags needed — all positional)
  2. fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda la cukta (tag x3 and x1, x2 positional)

Exercise 3: Create Mixed Sentences

Write sentences with one element out of order, using minimal tags:

  1. Book first: I give a book to Alice.
  2. Price first: I sell a car to Bob for 500.
Answers
  1. fe la cukta fa mi cu dunda fi la .alis.
  2. fo mu no no fa mi cu vecnu la karce la .bob.

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. Normal order: mi dunda la cukta la .bob.
  2. Recipient first: fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda la cukta
  3. Price first: fo mu no fa mi cu vecnu la skami do

Today's Vocab

No new gismu — focus on efficient tag usage.

Mixing summary:

Strategy Example
All positional mi dunda la cukta la .bob.
All tagged fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta fi la .bob.
Mixed fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda la cukta

Summary

You learned to mix place tags with positional placement. Tag only what's out of order; untagged sumti fill remaining places sequentially.
